result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan M Miller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Defendant to report to probation intake and provide DNA sample by 04-13-2022

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample. Pay all supervision fees, court costs, fees and surcharges including: DNA surcharge during period of probation. Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.

- NO VIOLENT CONTACT with M.M.
- NO CONTACT with firearms.

- All programming already completed can be applied to probation.
- Batterers Intervention Program.
- Mental Health Evaluation; comply with recommended treatment.
- Treatment and/or counseling as determined by agent.

- AODA assessment; comply with recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jonathan M Miller

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Parties have reached a resolution.  Plea hearing held.  
  
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1.  

Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court orders current terms and conditions of bail to continue pending sentencing hearing. Matter adjourned for sentencing hearing.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.

Defendant Jonathan M Miller in court with attorney Michael J Steinle.  Sara Nicole Volden Sadowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for initial appearance. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
